lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kwCI Pl hyq ibibiD ibrK ropY inhPl rhY ibrKY n kwhU kwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kaachhee Dhal Hayt Bibidhi Birakh Ropai , Nihadhal Rahai Birakhai N Kaahoo Kaaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a gardener plants saplings of many trees for obtaining fruits, but one which does not bear any fruit becomes useless.

lines.gurmukhi: sMqiq nimiq niRp Aink ibvwh krY sMqiq ibhUn binqw n giH Cwij hY
lines.transliteration_english: Santati Namiti Nrip Anik Bivaah Karai , Santati Bihoon Banitaa N Grih Chhaaji Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king marries many women for obtaining a heir of his kingdom, but the queen who does not bear him a child is not liked by anyone in the family.

lines.gurmukhi: ibidAw dwn jwn jYsy pwDw ctswr jorY ibidAw hIn dIn Kl nwm auprwij hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bidiaa Daan Jaan Jaisay Paadhaa Chatasaar Jorai , Bidiaa Heen Deen Khal Naam Ouparaaji Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a teacher opens a school but the child who remains illiterate is called lazy and foolish.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur isK swKw sMgHY suigAwn nimiq ibn gur igAwn DiRg jnm kau lwij hY ]415]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sikh Saakhaa Sangrahai Sougiaan Namiti , Bin Gur Giaan Dhrig Janam Kau Laaji Hai ?415?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, True Guru holds a congregation of his disciples in order to impart them with supreme form of knowledge (Naam). But he who remains bereft of Guru's teachings, is worthy of condemnation and is a blotch on the human birth.  (415)
